column1: Grugliasco (Italian: [ɡruʎˈʎasko]; Piedmontese: Grujasch [ɡryˈjɑsk] (listen)) is a comune (municipality) in the Metropolitan City of Turin in the Italian region of Piedmont
column2: located about 9 kilometres (6 miles) west of Turin.

column1: Grugliasco borders the following municipalities: Turin
column3: and Rivoli.  In 1945 here and in Collegno members of the retreating German 34th Infantry Division and 5th Mountain Division killed 68 civilians in retaliation for a partisan ambush.
